meanings.definition: The process of causing someone to adopt radical positions or beliefs.
meanings.sent1: The radicalizations of individuals can have a significant impact on society.
meanings.sent2: She observed the radicalizations of her friends as they joined different political groups.
meanings.sent3: The radicalizations of the puppies to only eat treats made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His sudden radicalizations in taste from sweet to spicy foods surprised his family.
meanings.sent5: The radicalizations of the plants towards the sunlight were fascinating to watch.

meanings.sent1: The radicalizations of young people often occur during times of social unrest.
meanings.sent2: After experiencing discrimination, she went through a period of radicalizations.
meanings.sent3: The radicalizations of the squirrels to only collect shiny objects amused the park visitors.
meanings.sent4: His radicalizations in fashion sense made him stand out in the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The radicalizations of the clouds from white to pink at sunset were breathtaking.
